title: Innovation vouchers for SMEs

author: Frits von Meijenfeldt, Ministry of Economic Affairs, The Netherlands

segmentation: As I already shared a lot of these features are used to address fundamental research issues and that's it's no surprise deaths.
Most of the functions are really.
Go to the universities mostly.
Actually I have to say to the street technical universities we have in Holland, but also to the Agriculture, University and some of the other universities.
Then we have also a number of other institutes of higher education with also are growingly addressing arisha research questions.
But most in the in terms of applicable research and they are also very useful.
To support and to work together with small and medium sized enterprises.
And of course we have a number of specific research institutes like also this Justice Stephen Institutes via for example to you know this is also famous outside the Dutch boundary boundaries.
It's a bit similar like Justice Stephen Institutes and also they work together with service with small and medium sized enterprises.
Did nice part of this.
Instrument is that actually a number of universities and also research institutes started to open a special account for small and medium sized enterprises.
They started to have an accountant to help those those enterprises in.
In the questions that they are raising to the to the researches and seeing how they could establish.
Sustainable relations relationships with those companies.
They see the advantage for them as well.
Of course there are also large research institutes by multinational companies like Philips and Shell etc.
And sometimes you can also which go with your voucher to those laps.
Becausw they are basically nonprofit research labs and.
It's also possible to go to foreign foreign research institutes like the Frauenhofer Institute or even two foreign universities.
We're open to death.
So.
We had a evaluation of the system how it works and how it's it could be, how it could be improved in for further and from that information we learned that.
People were very positive on it.
Why?
Because it's very easy to get too.
If you you applied for it by Internet and it's still available, then it costs you only 8 minutes to get to get.
The application is granted and that's that's rather fast.
There are, you see that there is a wide range of uses from fairly different sectors making use out of it.
It held as I said, it's to bridge the gap between universities, other knowledge institutes and companies, small and medium size companies.
And basically it's a fairly easy instrument.
So no, not much red tape.
Basically the the voucher is granted to accompany the company goes to the Institute and the Institute can go to the agency which was granting the.
Default sure to get the money after checking off if the real service was supposedly provided for.
So did it wasn't a success.
We asked to the companies who made use of the pouches and a 80% of them said yes do to you to the Corporation which instantly Research Institute.
My project was going through, while otherwise it wouldn't go through or advent much faster than I otherwise would have done so.
What we called the additionality was in the range of 8%.
An even there also people from the notice institutes were quite positive about about this instrument and about what they could do and could mean for for the commercial enterprises so well.
Of course it is our small amounts in our small questions, so the overall economic impact is still very limited.
But the most important thing is that it's bridges the gap and that it brings together.
People researches from knowledge institutes and people from Assamese.
Of course, there's not only positive aspects there also, so drawbacks.
One of them is apparently the system is so popular that the vouchers are sold out very, very quickly, so apparently there is much more demands than we can afford to supply due to budget restrictions.
Another problem that a lot of companies apply for a voucher but not all of them really made use of them, so they have to cut the rights for voucher.
They have that voucher and then of the accounts agree with Research Institute or whatever for whatever reason they don't use it and that's not what we what we meant with the system.
So I guess that's a drawback and sometimes notice institutes also rather creative.
Well, people in the world are creative, let's you will see that here in Slovenia, and that's in Holland's famous face similar, but they organize, for example a workshop or symposium invites.
Companies say, well, the price of it is 2500, so pay with your voucher and we address your issue and then The thing is solved.
Well, that was not the meaning of this instrument, so we now have.
Changed it a little bit so that this kind of creativity is reduced.
We are now thinking of how to proceed with it and we are still in the process of reflection on that.

But that's partly due to the fact that also not only here in Slovenia, but also we have to reduce to cut our spending of the government so budgets are reduced and also where we had 30,000,000 available in this year in 2010.
Apparently we will have only 20,000,000 available next year.
And that means that we have to change or make certain changes in our system.
But basically you can say this is a faithful instrument to bring a good relationship between people in the research institutes and people on the working ground.
That's in a few slides.
My presentation about this that system.
Thank you very much.
